An important potential approach to COVID-19 control is the use of BCG vaccine
40 for COVID-19, which was developed by Jean-Marie Canille Guerin and Albert Calmette around 100Â years back for immunization against Tuberculosis (TB), one of the most dreaded human diseases caused by M. tuberculosis (MTB). TB is predominant in developing countries and connected with poverty status, and control of TB is at least an issue of equity and human rights.
41 In areas with high burden of TB, control strategies for TB are overpowered by the rising cases of TB, occurring in parallel with HIV/AIDS pandemic.
